unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: Telecommunications: Fiber to Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India

unnormalised: New Delhi – Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) announced on 10/11/2024 a significant acceleration in its Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) deployment across Tier-II and Tier-III cities, aiming to bridge the digital divide. The initiative, dubbed "BharatNet Phase 2.5," targets connecting approximately 50,000 additional households in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar by Q1 2025.
normalised: New Delhi – Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (B S N L) announced on tenth november two thousand and twenty four a significant acceleration in its Fiber to the Home (F T T H) deployment across Tier two and Tier three cities, aiming to bridge the digital divide. The initiative, dubbed "BharatNet Phase two point five," targets connecting approximately fifty thousand additional households in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar by Q one two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio Infocomm continues its aggressive FTTH expansion, reportedly adding approximately 200,000 new subscribers in the last quarter. Analysts at Motilal Oswal project a sustained growth trajectory, fuelled by increasing data consumption and demand for OTT services.
normalised: Reliance Jio Infocomm continues its aggressive F T T H expansion, reportedly adding approximately two hundred thousand new subscribers in the last quarter.
